title: Democracy in India isn't in danger or collapsing. Human rights in India is a different story
selftext:
In Freedom House's Freedom in the World report, India scores 33 out of 40 in "political rights", and in The Economist's Democracy Index, India scores 8.67 out of 10 in "electoral process and pluralism" and 7.50 out of 10 in "functioning of government". Yes, these scores have come down since 2014, but in no way to the extent that would indicate India's democracy is collapsing.

What should be talked about is how violations of human rights by the Indian government have increased under Modi's BJP.
